messages.content: You are an expert in performance prediction for nitride materials.

Tc2N is Molybdenite structured and crystallizes in the hexagonal P6_3/mmc space group. The structure is two-dimensional and consists of two Tc2N sheets oriented in the (0, 0, 1) direction. Tc(1) is bonded in a 3-coordinate geometry to three equivalent N(1) atoms. All Tc(1)-N(1) bond lengths are 2.14 Å. N(1) is bonded to six equivalent Tc(1) atoms to form distorted edge-sharing NTc6 pentagonal pyramids. What is the Band Gap and Predicted Formation Energy of this nitride material?
Band Gap : 0.0 eV; Predicted Formation Energy : -0.23295873624999702 eV/atom.
You are an expert in performance prediction for nitride materials.

Tc3N crystallizes in the hexagonal P-6m2 space group. There are two inequivalent Tc sites. In the first Tc site, Tc(1) is bonded to six equivalent Tc(1) and six equivalent Tc(2) atoms to form TcTc12 cuboctahedra that share corners with six equivalent Tc(1)Tc12 cuboctahedra, corners with twelve equivalent N(1)Tc6 pentagonal pyramids, edges with six equivalent Tc(1)Tc12 cuboctahedra, faces with six equivalent Tc(1)Tc12 cuboctahedra, and faces with two equivalent N(1)Tc6 pentagonal pyramids. All Tc(1)-Tc(1) bond lengths are 2.80 Å. All Tc(1)-Tc(2) bond lengths are 2.68 Å. In the second Tc site, Tc(2) is bonded in a 3-coordinate geometry to three equivalent Tc(1) and three equivalent N(1) atoms. All Tc(2)-N(1) bond lengths are 2.13 Å. N(1) is bonded to six equivalent Tc(2) atoms to form distorted NTc6 pentagonal pyramids that share corners with twelve equivalent Tc(1)Tc12 cuboctahedra, edges with six equivalent N(1)Tc6 pentagonal pyramids, and faces with two equivalent Tc(1)Tc12 cuboctahedra. What is the Band Gap and Predicted Formation Energy of this nitride material?
Band Gap : 0.0 eV; Predicted Formation Energy : -0.22337149218749902 eV/atom.
You are an expert in performance prediction for nitride materials.

Tc4N3 is MAX Phase-derived structured and crystallizes in the trigonal R-3m space group. The structure is two-dimensional and consists of three Tc4N3 sheets oriented in the (0, 0, 1) direction. There are two inequivalent Tc sites. In the first Tc site, Tc(1) is bonded to three equivalent N(1) and three equivalent N(2) atoms to form a mixture of edge and corner-sharing TcN6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedra are not tilted. All Tc(1)-N(1) bond lengths are 2.17 Å. All Tc(1)-N(2) bond lengths are 2.20 Å. In the second Tc site, Tc(2) is bonded in a 3-coordinate geometry to three equivalent N(1) atoms. All Tc(2)-N(1) bond lengths are 2.15 Å. There are two inequivalent N sites. In the first N site, N(1) is bonded to three equivalent Tc(1) and three equivalent Tc(2) atoms to form a mixture of edge and corner-sharing NTc6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedral tilt angles are 1°. In the second N site, N(2) is bonded to six equivalent Tc(1) atoms to form a mixture of edge and corner-sharing NTc6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedral tilt angles are 1°. What is the Band Gap and Predicted Formation Energy of this nitride material?
Band Gap : 0.0 eV; Predicted Formation Energy : 0.086791708690477 eV/atom.
You are an expert in performance prediction for nitride materials.

TcN is Tetraauricupride structured and crystallizes in the cubic Pm-3m space group. Tc(1) is bonded in a body-centered cubic geometry to eight equivalent N(1) atoms. All Tc(1)-N(1) bond lengths are 2.32 Å. N(1) is bonded in a body-centered cubic geometry to eight equivalent Tc(1) atoms. What is the Band Gap and Predicted Formation Energy of this nitride material?
Band Gap : 0.0 eV; Predicted Formation Energy : 0.589942441145833 eV/atom.
You are an expert in performance prediction for nitride materials.

TcN is Zincblende, Sphalerite structured and crystallizes in the cubic F-43m space group. Tc(1) is bonded to four equivalent N(1) atoms to form corner-sharing TcN4 tetrahedra. All Tc(1)-N(1) bond lengths are 1.99 Å. N(1) is bonded to four equivalent Tc(1) atoms to form corner-sharing NTc4 tetrahedra. What is the Band Gap and Predicted Formation Energy of this nitride material?
Band Gap : 0.0 eV; Predicted Formation Energy : -0.08000038385416601 eV/atom.
You are an expert in performance prediction for nitride materials.

TcN is Halite, Rock Salt structured and crystallizes in the cubic Fm-3m space group. Tc(1) is bonded to six equivalent N(1) atoms to form a mixture of edge and corner-sharing TcN6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedra are not tilted. All Tc(1)-N(1) bond lengths are 2.16 Å. N(1) is bonded to six equivalent Tc(1) atoms to form a mixture of edge and corner-sharing NTc6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedra are not tilted. What is the Band Gap and Predicted Formation Energy of this nitride material?
Band Gap : 0.0 eV; Predicted Formation Energy : 0.37028458614583504 eV/atom.

TcN is Tungsten Carbide structured and crystallizes in the hexagonal P-6m2 space group. Tc(1) is bonded to six equivalent N(1) atoms to form a mixture of distorted edge, face, and corner-sharing TcN6 pentagonal pyramids. All Tc(1)-N(1) bond lengths are 2.18 Å. N(1) is bonded to six equivalent Tc(1) atoms to form a mixture of distorted edge, face, and corner-sharing NTc6 pentagonal pyramids. TcN crystallizes in the tetragonal P4_2/mmc space group. Tc(1) is bonded in a square co-planar geometry to four equivalent N(1) atoms. All Tc(1)-N(1) bond lengths are 2.05 Å. TcN is Tungsten Carbide-like structured and crystallizes in the hexagonal P6_3/mmc space group. Tc(1) is bonded to six equivalent N(1) atoms to form a mixture of edge, face, and corner-sharing TcN6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedral tilt angles are 44°. All Tc(1)-N(1) bond lengths are 2.17 Å. N(1) is bonded to six equivalent Tc(1) atoms to form a mixture of distorted edge and corner-sharing NTc6 pentagonal pyramids. What is the Band Gap and Predicted Formation Energy of this nitride material?
Band Gap : 0.0 eV; Predicted Formation Energy : -0.040995013854164 eV/atom.

TcN2 is Fluorite structured and crystallizes in the cubic Fm-3m space group. Tc(1) is bonded in a body-centered cubic geometry to eight equivalent N(1) atoms. All Tc(1)-N(1) bond lengths are 2.12 Å. N(1) is bonded to four equivalent Tc(1) atoms to form a mixture of edge and corner-sharing NTc4 tetrahedra. What is the Band Gap and Predicted Formation Energy of this nitride material?
Band Gap : 0.0 eV; Predicted Formation Energy : 0.6116609524305521 eV/atom.
